Description: Marl pottery vase,of late wavy-handle type, with nearly cylindrical in shape with walls swelling to slight shoulder, slight inset neck, everted roll-over rim, and applied band of clay with impressed pie-crust decoration around shoulder.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna (London, 1911), p. 20; cf pl. xxxiii W55 Like Wavy handle W56A in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Grave H122 (d) marked on base.
